text: San José is a province of Costa Rica. It is in the central part of the country. The provincial capital, and the national capital since 1823, is the city of San José. ==Location== The San José province borders with the Alajuela and Heredia provinces to the north, with the Cartago and Limón provinces to the east; and the Puntarenas to the south and the west. ==Geography== San José is in the central part of the country. The province has an area of . The main mountains in the province are Turrubares, Camora, Cangreja, Nara, Cerro de la Muerte, San Jerónimo and Las Vueltas. Some of the rivers that flow through the province are Grande de Candelaria, Pirrís, Virilla, Naranjo, División, Chirripó, General y Pejibaye. ==Demographics== People from the province are known as josefinos (women:josefinas). The San José province had a population, in 2011, of 1,404,242 for a population density of inhabitants/km2. The canton of San José, with 288,054 inhabitants, is the canton with more inhabitants.
